p: The complete chloroplast (cp) genome consists of a pair of inverted repeats (IRs), separated by a large single-copy (LSC) region and a small single-copy (SSC) region, these four parts constitute a conserved structure of the complete cp genome (Wolfe et al. 1992; Lee et al. 2007). This report will be very important for studying the phylogenetic relationships of Stellaria dichotoma and Caryophyllaceae.
